Font Families

Font families can be added via _type.scss and imported to this list via styleguide/_scss2json.scss.

Family: $font-family-base

Fonts: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica Neue, Arial, sans-serif, Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, Segoe UI Symbol

            
  .class {
    font-family: $font-family-base;
  }

Regular

Et sapiente nulla autem repudiandae aspernatur.

Bold

Et sapiente nulla autem repudiandae aspernatur.

Italic

Et sapiente nulla autem repudiandae aspernatur.

Family: $font-family-monospace

Fonts: SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, Liberation Mono, Courier New, monospace

            
  .class {
    font-family: $font-family-monospace;
  }

Regular

Et sapiente nulla autem repudiandae aspernatur.

Bold

Et sapiente nulla autem repudiandae aspernatur.

Italic

Et sapiente nulla autem repudiandae aspernatur.

Font Sizes

Font sizes can be added via _type.scss and imported to this list via styleguide/_scss2json.scss.

    Sm: 0.875rem

    culpa voluptas non delectus vel veniam non

    Lg: 1.25rem

    culpa voluptas non delectus vel veniam non

    Base: 1rem

    culpa voluptas non delectus vel veniam non

Headings

These are heading styles, including both element and classed version. Use the element version in markup following Accessibility guidelines. Use the class version to match font styling of heading. See WebAim for details.

Header Code

voluptas neque accusamus

 <h1 contenteditable>h1. voluptas neque accusamus</h1>

voluptas neque accusamus

 <h2 contenteditable>h1. voluptas neque accusamus</h2>

voluptas neque accusamus

 <h3 contenteditable>h1. voluptas neque accusamus</h3>

voluptas neque accusamus

 <h4 contenteditable>h1. voluptas neque accusamus</h4>
voluptas neque accusamus
 <h5 contenteditable>h1. voluptas neque accusamus</h5>
voluptas neque accusamus
 <h6 contenteditable>h1. voluptas neque accusamus</h6>

You can use these as either the element or as a class. For example:

Paragraph Code

voluptas neque accusamus

 <p class="h1">p1. voluptas neque accusamus</p>

voluptas neque accusamus

 <p class="h2">p2. voluptas neque accusamus</p>

voluptas neque accusamus

 <p class="h3">p3. voluptas neque accusamus</p>

voluptas neque accusamus

 <p class="h4">p4. voluptas neque accusamus</p>

voluptas neque accusamus

 <p class="h5">p5. voluptas neque accusamus</p>

voluptas neque accusamus

 <p class="h6">p6. voluptas neque accusamus</p>

Display headings

Bootstrap style for larger headlines. For example:

Display Heading Code

et amet

 <h1 class="display-1">et amet</h1>

et amet

 <h1 class="display-2">et amet</h1>

et amet

 <h1 class="display-3">et amet</h1>

et amet

 <h1 class="display-4">et amet</h1>

Text Styles

Lead

A paragraph p class to help text standout. Et blanditiis sit et explicabo nesciunt praesentium praesentium. Corrupti alias est beatae quasi quidem consequatur ipsa.

          
  <p class="lead">
    Et sapiente nulla autem repudiandae aspernatur.
  </p>

Paragraphs

Paragraph One Dignissimos rerum minima quam ratione culpa voluptas et. Iure vitae iste eligendi facere non. Reprehenderit iure est id neque ea facilis iure quidem. Atque sint voluptate ipsa minima cumque qui. Voluptatem dolorem qui in quas sed. At et inventore qui. Reprehenderit consectetur et odio sit.

Paragraph Two after an hr Dignissimos rerum minima quam ratione culpa voluptas et. Iure vitae iste eligendi facere non. Reprehenderit iure est id neque ea facilis iure quidem. Atque sint voluptate ipsa minima cumque qui. Voluptatem dolorem qui in quas sed. At et inventore qui. Reprehenderit consectetur et odio sit.

Misc

This is a text link.

Italic text is used for stylistic purposes in i

This text has added emphasis in em

Bolded text is used for stylistic purposes in b

Strong is used to indicate strong importance in strong

This text is superscript

This text is subscript

A block quotation (also known as a long quotation or extract) is a quotation in a written document, that is set off from the main text as a paragraph, or block of text, and typically distinguished visually using indentation and a different typeface or smaller size quotation.

Lists

  • This is a list item in an Unordered List
  • An unordered list is a list in which the sequence of items is not important. Sometimes, an unordered list is a bulleted list. And this is a long list item in an unordered list that can wrap onto a new line.
  • Lists can be nested inside of each other
    • This is a nested list item
    • This is another nested list item in an unordered list
  • This is the last list item
  1. This is a list item in an Ordered List
  2. An ordered list is a list in which the sequence of items is important. An ordered list does not necessarily contain sequence characters.
  3. Lists can be nested inside of each other
    1. This is a nested list item
    2. This is another nested list item in an ordered list
  4. This is the last list item
Definition List
A number of connected items or names written or printed consecutively, typically one below the other.
This is a term.
This is the definition of that term, which both live in a dl.
Here is another term.
And it gets a definition too, which is this line.
Here is term that shares a definition with the term below.
And it gets a definition too, which is this line.
